messages.message: @puneet are there docs that you had provided at some point for this?

Here is the doc for context propagation - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EI6yJo-FXC8y2iarXCEgU30Df4cMhicoYLhNdCRXP30/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.bwbl56b71han
As Matt mentioned context.Context is a go convention where every function should have context as the first parameter and can be used to store request level state.
Context propagation is something we build which enables tracing and also stores request level context accross services i.e. both python and golang.
Currently we do not have user email or org name in the context, we only have `is_synthetic_traffic` and `correlation-id`  keys present in the context which is populated in the python webservers.
